data.title: A Cool Place for a Hot Burger
data.text: Tucked into a residential neighborhood along busy Arapahoe Ave, this is a great burger place. It has a very limited burger and fries menu, but the staff is upbeat, the atmosphere is relaxed and the food is really good!!! A perfect place when the weather is sunny, which is most of the time. The prices are very reasonable!!!

data.title: Great shack
data.text: In need of food on our way to the Rocky Mountain National park while visiting friends. They had never been here and we just randomly gave it ago. Well the burger was as tasty as it smelled. My friend also said its the best shake he had had in a long time.

data.title: Snarfburger is great
data.text: Its a hole in the wall with great burgers, great fries.  You stand around waiting for it, but what else can you do?

data.title: Best Veggie Burger in TOWN!
data.text: Love this place.  AND LOVE the Burgers.  Both Veggie and MEATy styles.  Best place for a hangover burger and fries for sure.  AND They have Custard and great fries. 9/10....  Parking is hard sometimes, but I could also ride my bike.

data.title: Good grilled burgers
data.text: We were there on a Thursday night and had no wait. The staff was friendly. Our burgers were thick and the buns filled with ordered extras. The french fries and onion rings were tasty, but nothing special. There is not much seating inside (a few stools).. Several metal picnic style benches are available outside. Fortunately, the weather was decent.

data.title: Snarf, make sandwiches not burgers
data.text: I must admit I had been hoping for a burger that was as well put together and delicious as the Snarf sandwiches, but no.  I even tried the special mushroom burger, and although the staff was fast and friendly, it didn't make up for a very ordinary average burger. Too bad for SnarfBurger, but at least we'll always have the real Snarfs.

data.title: A good burger, bu the wait is too long.
data.text: This is a small place with only outside seating, good burgers, close to the CU campus.  Worth a try if you are not in a hurry.

data.title: Pretty good burgers and shakes
data.text: Love Snarfs, so tried their burger joint.  A spartan location, with very basic stools to eat your burger, better in summer months when you can eat outside.  Burgers are pretty good.  Shakes are pretty good.  Fries just OK.  I like Larkburger better.

data.title: Hands-down, one of the best burgers around.
data.text:
If you are looking for a decadent and "juicy" hamburger, you must visit Snarfburger. It's not something I could do overly frequently, but the flavor is incredible. Order the double, as that seems to be the best flavor profile. (we have eaten there twice now). 
Yes, this place gets a pretty diverse set of reviews on social media, but it's hard to argue with one essential fact – they just have great burgers. You definitely cannot eat it in your car, and do not be overly dressed, because you will drip on your clothes.

If you are not counting calories one particular meal, you must check them out.

data.title: Love Snarfs
data.text: Not the cleanest looking place but OK. I love their chicken salad and their peppers topping. being gluten free they do have a gluten free hoagie which is acceptable.

data.title: Very fresh food
data.text: little small and understated outside but worth it for anyone who is in the hood. they have great desserts for post lunch or to bring back to the office for others.

data.title: birthday burger
data.text: delicious birthday burger cooked yo order rand fresh french fries and a naughty sundae for dessertI even have a photo yo prove iy

data.title: Friendly Service. Great Burgers, Fries, Malts.  Seating at Picnic Tables on Street.
data.text:
If you have ever had the good fortune to eat a burger from Bud's Broiler in New Orleans, you will appreciate the juiciness of the Snarf Burger, and the Snarf Burgers come standard with cheese and plenty of trimmings. 

If you're on a budget or just want a really great burger and don't mind sitting at a picnic table on the sidewalk, Get Over To Snarf Burger!

data.title: Sandwich made to order and taste
data.text: The sandwiches are made well; satisfying and to order.  Price is reasonable and the staff is efficient. I ordered a beef and swiss cheese sandwich. A one-half size was a most satisfying portion; i was replete.  Ambiance is basic but comfortable with a fairly high level of noise, making conversation somewhat problematic.  A fun experience overall.

data.title: A bit greasy and overpriced, but good.
data.text:
Got some burgers, fries, onion rings and an oreo concrete.

Everything was good, but really the fries and rings weren't anything to write home about.

Also, it was all pretty greasy, but the burgers were good. Slightly pink inside, charred outside, covered in add-ons. Just a tad too salty.

The concrete was Baller, but I dunno about the cost vs taste/size ratio.

data.title: Very greasy and mediocre food
data.text: This place is very popular among students due to the location. The food, however, isn't very good. When you enter the building a greasy cloud hits your face that makes you want to get out of there ASAP. Their frozen custard is good though.

data.title: Extreme Dislike
data.text: The burgers are nothing but grease. Gave me terrible indigestion. Never again. Just don't go here. Much prefer Larkburger.

data.title: Classic
data.text: Classic burgers and fries. Freshly made, quick service, good selection of classic toppings. Not much seating - it's definitely a take-it-to-go kind of place. Definitely better than many fast options and just as convenient.

user_location.name: New Hampshire Lakes Region, New Hampshire

data.title: Server was eating the food!
data.text: I hate to write a bad review about this place because the burgers are delicious BUT the server was eating the whole time he was putting together my order!  Yuck!!  And he forgot my custard.  Had to go back and ask for it.  We love the food but today was a real turn-off!

data.title: Great Snarfs Tradition
data.text: If you've ever had a Snarfs sandwich, you know they can't be beat. Snarfburger is a great followup. Burgers have their own twist... a spicy sauce. Also, amazing milkshakes, and when comfort is required, great traditional grilled cheese sandwiches.
